story.text: (Repeating to attach related alerts)Jan 2 (Reuters) - Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. (PEG.N) said a subsidiary of it would sell an Indiana facility to a unit of American Electric Power Co. Inc. (AEP.N) for $325 million and take a related charge of 83 cents a share in the fourth quarter. PSEG Power LLC would sell the 1096-megawatt Lawrenceburg Energy Center in Lawrenceburg to AEP Generating Co., the companies said in separate statements. The proceeds, together with anticipated reduction in tax liability, will be about $425 million, which will be used to retire debt, PSEG said. (Reporting by Sankalp Saini in Bangalore)
story.title: rpt - pseg unit to sell indiana facility , to take q4 charge
